title: Jayme de Almeida
text:
Jayme de Almeida Filho (born 17 March 1953), known as Jayme de Almeida, is a Brazilian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> manager and former player who played as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">centre-back</a>.
Playing career.
Jayme de Almeida was born in <a href="Rio%20de%20Janeiro">Rio de Janeiro</a>, son of <a href="CR%20Flamengo">Flamengo</a> ex-player and coach <a href="Jaime%20de%20Almeida">Jaime de Almeida</a>. He played as a defender at Flamengo, his father's former club, between 1973 and 1977, in 198 games, scoring three goals during that time. He then joined <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Paulo%20FC">São Paulo</a>, where he played 55 matches between 1977 and 1980, the team winning the <a href="Campeonato%20Paulista">Campeonato Paulista</a> in 1980. In 1980, he had a stint at <a href="Sport%20Club%20do%20Recife">Sport</a>, arriving during the <a href="Campeonato%20Pernambucano">Campeonato Pernambucano</a>, which they won that year. He later played for <a href="Guarani%20Futebol%20Clube">Guarani</a>. He served in the <a href="Brazil%20national%20football%20team">Brazil national football team</a> in 1976.
Post-playing career.
He debuted as a coach for <a href="Associa%C3%A7%C3%A3o%20Desportiva%20Ferrovi%C3%A1ria%20Vale%20do%20Rio%20Doce">Desportiva Ferroviaria</a> in 1992; that year they won the Championship Capixaba. He was manager for <a href="Iraty%20Sport%20Club">Iraty</a> in 2009.
He assumed the post of technical assistant at <a href="Vanderlei%20Luxemburgo">Vanderlei Luxemburgo</a> in October 2010. and with the fall of the then coach, commanded interim time in games of has assumed interim time in games of <a href="Ta%C3%A7a%20Guanabara">Taça Guanabara</a> that year.
With the unexpected exit Mano Menezes upturn command, again as interim and months after being hired. where in that year was <a href="2013%20Copa%20do%20Brasil">Copa do Brasil</a>.
